\date{Submitted to Astronomische Nachrichten, January 2000} 
\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
The paper deals with the 
 integral equation approach to  steady kinematic dynamo 
 models in 
finite domains 
based on Biot-Savart's law. The role of the 
electric potential at the boundary is worked out explicitly. 
As an example, a modified version of the simple 
spherical $\alpha$-effect
dynamo model proposed by Krause and Steenbeck is considered
in which the $\alpha$-coefficient is no longer constant but may vary
with the radial coordinate. In particular, the results for
the original model are re-derived.
Possible applications of this integral equation approach for
numerical simulations of dynamos in arbitrary geometry and
for an ''inverse dynamo theory'' are sketched.
\end{abstract}
